messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Grammar
messages.msgSnippet: I buy it.  Necause I know the different but often end up having to correct your to you re when I m typing.  I m not sure why either, probably for the same
messages.messageBody:
I buy it. Necause I know the different but often end up having to
correct your to you're when I'm typing. I'm not sure why either,
probably for the same reason that if I write a word that ends in T
followed by the word it, there are often breasts in my writing. Or the
reason why the word THE becomes TEH so easily. Anyway, I have several
typos that I make a LOT and your is one of them.

Bridget
S�och�in ar domhan,

caves in which we hide.
-- F. Scott Fitzgerald
> Date: Fri, 15 Mar 2002 09:20:04 -0800
> From: Tia Leschke <leschke@...>
> Subject: Re: grammar

>
> I find that hard to buy. I can see leaving out a letter sometimes,
but
> always the same letter and apostrophe? I pointed it out because so
many
> people on my homeschooling lists don't seem to know the difference.
(Well,
> I'd say many people don't know the difference. I see it on signs,
letters
> to the editor, even magazine articles sometimes.)
> Tia
>
> No one can make you feel inferior without your consent.
